page.title: 16Interviews 2
page.content:
The lady had lived in the village since 1948. Since then the farm had changed hands and the estate sold to arabs, who now owned all the houses.
Her husband worked for the estate, while Mr. Wright rented the land. They had half an acre of land which was not their own. She liked the village, particularly for the quiet.
None of her ancestors lived here, and there were no clubs or anything. She said it was boring for youngsters. There was no policeman, and one needed a car to live here. Once upon a time there was a post office.
contd on P17
